summary: Directed evolution often discovers distant mutations that increase enzyme enantioselectivity more effectively than random mutagenesis targeting the substrate binding site.
key_claims: Random mutagenesis of Pseudomonas fluorescens esterase increased enantioselectivity from E = 12 to E = 19.
Directed evolution found mutations far from the active site that significantly improved enantioselectivity, reaching up to E = 61.

process_signals.value: 12-14 Å for most mutations, up to 22 Å
